com.avaya.csta.async

Interface AsynchronousServices


  • public interface AsynchronousServices
    AsynchronousServices allows client applications to receive responses to requests asynchronously. AsynchronousServices does not provide support for receiving responses to all method calls asynchronously. If a call is made to AsynchronousServices against a method that is not supported by AsynchronousServices, a ServiceNotSupportedException will be thrown. The list of methods currently suppported is:
    • RegistrationServices.registerTerminal(com.avaya.csta.binding.RegisterTerminalRequest)
    • RegistrationServices.unregisterTerminal(com.avaya.csta.binding.UnregisterTerminalRequest)
    • CallControlServices.alternateCall(ch.ecma.csta.binding.AlternateCall)
    • CallControlServices.answerCall(ch.ecma.csta.binding.AnswerCall)
    • CallControlServices.clearCall(ch.ecma.csta.binding.ClearCall)
    • CallControlServices.clearConnection(ch.ecma.csta.binding.ClearConnection)
    • CallControlServices.conferenceCall(ch.ecma.csta.binding.ConferenceCall)
    • CallControlServices.consultationCall(ch.ecma.csta.binding.ConsultationCall)
    • CallControlServices.deflectCall(ch.ecma.csta.binding.DeflectCall)
    • CallControlServices.generateDigits(ch.ecma.csta.binding.GenerateDigits)
    • CallControlServices.holdCall(ch.ecma.csta.binding.HoldCall)
    • CallControlServices.makeCall(ch.ecma.csta.binding.MakeCall)
    • CallControlServices.reconnectCall(ch.ecma.csta.binding.ReconnectCall)
    • CallControlServices.retrieveCall(ch.ecma.csta.binding.RetrieveCall)
    • CallControlServices.singleStepConferenceCall(ch.ecma.csta.binding.SingleStepConferenceCall)
    • CallControlServices.singleStepTransferCall(ch.ecma.csta.binding.SingleStepTransferCall)
    • CallControlServices.transferCall(ch.ecma.csta.binding.TransferCall)
    • LogicalDeviceFeatureServices.getDoNotDisturb(ch.ecma.csta.binding.GetDoNotDisturb)
    • LogicalDeviceFeatureServices.setDoNotDisturb(ch.ecma.csta.binding.SetDoNotDisturb)
    • LogicalDeviceFeatureServices.getForwarding(ch.ecma.csta.binding.GetForwarding)
    • LogicalDeviceFeatureServices.setForwarding(ch.ecma.csta.binding.SetForwarding)
    • SnapshotServices.snapshotCall(ch.ecma.csta.binding.SnapshotCall)
    • SnapshotServices.snapshotDevice(ch.ecma.csta.binding.SnapshotDevice)
    • RouteingServices.routeRegister(ch.ecma.csta.binding.RouteRegister)
    • RouteingServices.routeRegisterCancel(ch.ecma.csta.binding.RouteRegisterCancel)
    • RouteingServices.routeSelect(ch.ecma.csta.binding.RouteSelect)
    • RouteingServices.routeEnd(ch.ecma.csta.binding.RouteEnd)
    • com.avaya.cmapi.callinformation.CallInformationServices#cancelTelephonyTones
    • com.avaya.cmapi.callinformation.CallInformationServices#generateTelephonyTones
    Version:
    4.1
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void sendRequest(java.lang.Object request, AsynchronousCallback callback)
      Method sendRequest is the single method exposed by AsynchronousServices to send requests asynchronously.

    • Method Detail

      • sendRequest

        void sendRequest(java.lang.Object request,
                 AsynchronousCallback callback)
          throws ServiceNotSupportedException
        Method sendRequest is the single method exposed by AsynchronousServices to send requests asynchronously.
        • Prerequisites, before using AsynchronousServices, do the following: Get access to AsynchrounousServices through the ServiceProvider. For example: 
           AsynchronousServices asyncSvc =
   (AsynchronousServices)servProv.getService(com.avaya.csta.async.AsynchronousServices.class.getName());
        • Using AsynchronousServices: To call the AsynchronousServices.sendRequest() method, your application must provide an instance of a class that implements the AsynchronousCallback interface. A new instance of a class that implements AsynchronousCallback should be instantiated and passed in as a parameter to each call made to the sendRequest method. The instance of the class that implements the AsynchronousCallback that is passed to the sendRequest method call will receive the callback from the AsynchronousServices with either a response or an exception. So the client application will use the Object instances that implement the AsynchronousCallback interface as the mapping between a particular request and a response. For example: 
          •  // MyAsynchronousCallback is a Class that implements AsynchronousCallback
 MyAsynchronousCallback callBackHandler = new MyAsynchronousCallback();
 
 // Instantiate the request object.  The details associated with populating the 
 // RegisterTerminalRequest have not been shown to shorten the length of the example.
 RegisterTerminalRequest registerTerminalRequest = new RegisterTerminalRequest();
  
 // Using the asyncSvc reference from the Prerequisites example section
 asyncSvc.sendRequest(registerTerminalRequest, callBackHandler);
        • When the AsynchronousServices receives a response from the server, the AsynchronousServices will call one of the methods on the AsychronousCallback object that was passed in as a parameter to the original sendRequest() call. If AsynchronousServices does not receive a response or an Exception for a request within 60 seconds, then the handleException() method will be called on the AsynchronousCallback handler indicating that the request timed out.
        Parameters:
        request - an Object that represents a synchronous request against the server.
        callback - an Object that implements the AsynchronousCallback interface.
        Throws:
        ServiceNotSupportedException - if the method is called with an unsupported Object request as a parameter.
